document.title: Mathematics Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools

9E172899F5724F129C36B9E27EC87CBD.description: complexity of algorithms with the same intended outcomes;

1EDBEE28FE974D3C82DFA0749835985E.description: Compare and contrast the efficiency of computer programs in terms of

61BFED939DF8482991E9D968E79092E0.description: The student will compare and contrast the efficiency of computer programs.

E373304DC30144CABDAE5BFCD6081537.description: use debugging tools available in the programming environment.

BFE34DC26E34490DA60C1F1F0457F51B.description: trace code to identify logic errors; and

C06942472629460E94FD2EAFB54E2CE6.description: disable a section of code by converting it into a comment;

7B05E0FF65F84DAFA2E8131850ACF05A.description: interpret syntax and runtime error messages;

EB1A0DD339B9472BB72BF21553ADE9F9.description: Debug a program using various techniques:

AAE9D86877A2499B9762327672D8C6D1.description: Differentiate among syntax errors, runtime errors, and logic errors.

3127BCCA0DE148919183642E88CAB184.description: The student will identify errors and debug a program using various techniques.

CC6B550667964D0F8D368BDA5E9AE166.description:
Test a program including boundary cases and inaccurate data types to verify the intended
outcomes.

00AA365F7CCE41E8B0EFD84DCC13D0CD.description: Produce a given output by entering a data set.

9186866CC95949D38C353A15ED3D6FAD.description: The student will test a program to match a sample output, using a set of data.

88E5AA7D1C66452B82BE4131159CB0E0.description: Use tracing to describe the intended purpose of existing code for an algorithm.

8961B17F5B264F07A2799691F6B8BDF4.description: predict return values of functions given specific arguments.

3CDDDCB3FAC74591AA75EF75E105B6A8.description: identify values at each stage of an algorithm; and

4C205FF9A8A340789536A5FD20773570.description: Trace existing code of an algorithm to

48BDD5F9267D4CD485C80FAF9F026EA2.description: The student will trace existing code to interpret the intended purpose.

2FF224F48EBD4D8989679C4E831A9AF7.description: Translate a mathematical expression or statement into a programming statement(s).

650555FC94A447A5AEE0826487B703A1.description: Implement order of operations, including logical and relational operators.

975CB348264C47AB929C4939696EBC8D.description: Declare, initialize, and assign variables to represent mathematical expressions or statements.

717FA2FF66A6474F9A9BBF7486F98919.description:
The student will translate a mathematical expression or statement into computer
code.

9F88D32F1ACE4830A4ED4BF82FDCA1C5.description:
Differentiate between the scopes of variables (e.g., global scope versus local scope) and verify
the intended use.

FE63BF361A2447AF8362087A7C3AA88E.description: Verify that global variables are set to constant values before run time.

52016FE88AB6499A8753A09EFEEA067D.description: Verify that the variable types are aligned to the purpose of the algorithm.

9DBA5218A47D4F82BC7BFC13DE814D2C.description: The student will verify how programs access and process variables.

F9235148F4BE4B63B3F6DFEE04D4080E.description: improve the readability of a program.

38DAAAD05FCE47D09275768485F398C2.description: align a previously created step-by-step plan to a written program;

5101A21360294ED49C7A446978BA3BF3.description: describe the overall purpose of a program;

42C4FE1D2B6B46C1B418EDBC0AC44BA1.description: Create documentation using written comments to:

899E0A99940748DD96002A6AEDD41D14.description:
The student will create documentation using written comments to annotate the
intended purpose of the components of a user-created program.

C4AC78642E4F44DDAB48AEDD5274ECA5.description: Write and implement computer programs to solve mathematical problems using

1D4CD9FCC3BD45E1A72627C13CFB6294.description:
Write a computer program that includes sequencing, selection (conditionals), and iteration
(loops).

6B75F55485364FED8E06432E3BB17AA9.description:
Determine what components of programming are needed to implement a step-by-step plan to
perform a specific task or solve a problem.

B6EAC705B6D64802A735679393E666E0.description:
The student will write and implement programs using sequencing, selection, and
iteration to perform a specific task or solve a problem, including those arising from
mathematical and interdisciplinary contexts.

1C3F8A56AEFB449BBE9835787BE01CBC.description:
Implement a sort routine on a one-dimensional list or an array (e.g., selection sort, insertion
sort, merge sort).

B8FE76F5D5D64ADD906AF844A50AA6E7.description:
Implement a search routine on a one-dimensional list or an array, including sequential search
and binary search.

34D6220FCED042EC84C7BC05917E7C45.description: Differentiate between types of sort routines.

976C5E43C29840C082AF05F54574610E.description: Differentiate between types of search routines.

CA6730EA9D38440B8CF0D67616CF34AB.description:
The student will implement pre-defined algorithms, including search routines and
sort routines.

DC0A9C4BBFFF43799D6783998C9EFD31.description: Write and implement functions that accept parameters.

5CAE5D783BBA4EC0A05B322E9CB96A25.description: Write and implement void functions and return functions.

1542B79232534A75B4D6732AD7177A40.description: Write and implement a user-defined function to complete a task or sub-task.

C2D6B594D6F44A0CBB2227729129FC99.description: The student will write and implement user-defined functions.

FE84F3EBE2C14A568AAF085AC7A1115B.description: Implement void library functions and return library functions.

2BD639FA2407440DB6DBF40402709010.description:
Implement library functions to perform mathematical operations (e.g., random, absolute
value, square root, power).

93FA7D20ACFC412A89B859EAE91CDB2C.description: Implement library functions to process data.

9212999A76DD4F7C88117527696447DD.description: The student will implement library functions.

F8C90F86AB9544089B6776D6EFADE918.description: Determine what output a program will produce given a specific input.

186E9ACF47EE4F829B68BB0D967B7893.description:
Validate input data using exception coding (e.g., using a “while” loop to control valid input
by a user).

B772940361D646FA9E8491DB8585ED1B.description: Write and implement input statements to store user given values into a program.

464B47C489A2484CBCCB66E81E4FB218.description: The student will write and implement the input phase of a computer program.

61BCD75510D04FB6A0656DABF9AE240D.description: sending output to a physical device (e.g., speakers, robots, LED lights).

9AA57FDC63AC4E51B8078A7BC7A7DE81.description: displaying output through a graphical user interface; and

FCCC4B8FE76F44E6BF674600CCF4172E.description: Write and implement the output phase of a computer program, which may include:

90D61A18E3A041CA97C01D964571F890.description: The student will write and implement the output phase of a computer program.

B8B8126335B649CEAB8DFC9110B37A27.description: Determine the outcome of code segments that include loops.

D807037EF9CC401184D3DA7424ACDDE3.description: Identify conditions that cause infinite loops.

E6D000B01FC041FCA2844F70651C23B1.description:
Differentiate between loops that run a fixed number of times and loops that run an indefinite
number of times (e.g., stopping dependent on variable conditions).

A0984B5CCCCE4B10BC58DCABFA51FA57.description: The student will perform iteration with loops.

E9E27C765B1D4D27A410A10DA12EE6C8.description: Determine which parts of an algorithm are executed based on a condition being true or false.

44B1D0F7F4C34F82953F30643BFF2566.description:
Write and implement compound conditional statements (e.g., nested conditionals, chained
conditional statements).

1718514288BC4A4C89CECA9031D8D206.description:
Write and implement Boolean expressions using logical and relational operators (e.g., !, &&,
||, ==, <, >, >=, <=, !=).

D60DEF45D5FD446DA959D47826B6138A.description:
The student will construct Boolean expressions and implement conditional
statements.

9B252751BA69473CB845F11F10C941AA.description:
Define the constraints of a task or problem (e.g., pre-conditions, post-conditions) to determine
the desired input and output.

B975EFC8EC56402C948DF63381B24D4D.description: Define the variables needed to perform a task or solve a problem.

07D1A3F63E174BE1A92BB25FF2F319D3.description:
Design a step-by-step plan to perform a task or solve a problem using a flowchart or
pseudocode that outlines the subtasks needed.

D356D8A1BB90479197B5F02BB91CCB0F.description:
The student will design a step-by-step plan to perform a task or solve a problem,
including those arising from mathematical or interdisciplinary contexts.

99F2A9E44512400EBE356949171476B2.description: Implement predefined objects to consolidate related information of different data types.

34B4369771E84D95B1B95E96EB31C78D.description: Access and manipulate a particular element of a list or an array.

869635DDA1A348AA91C2246F616A91C9.description: fill the list or array with data.

DE6384FF3D924EEF85D347F372DD4A9D.description: choose an appropriate data type for a list or an array; and

7051F751FA3B4C5DA988745C73D701CB.description: declare a list or array (one-dimensional or two-dimensional);

6BFDBBD936104F8694D48E7E801CF270.description: Perform tasks related to lists or arrays (one-dimensional or two-dimensional), including

252504BF15324CFBA27300F11EF70CE8.description:
Given a specific task or problem, determine the appropriate data structure (e.g., lists, arrays,
objects) to represent data.

F57EAA666F2C4B61895315796445FE6C.description: The student will represent data using appropriate data structures.

5D697CE0D96A463C9ED0FABB3A1A30AF.description:
Differentiate between variable data types to determine the data type needed based upon
intended use (e.g., character versus string, integer versus double/float).

55EAE71863D041168816F23101E32BBB.description: Describe the characteristics of different variable data types, including

132A679C5EEF455A87A665FD57286B95.description:
The student will differentiate between variable data types based upon their
characteristics.

8AAC34134F8948D18B85659C5725DC41.description: Convert data between number systems (e.g., binary to decimal, decimal to hexadecimal).

52195C00743D48C2BE7819AC00FFF02D.description: Represent data in different number systems, including binary, decimal, and hexadecimal.

1DD5C62D0F074C7B8A4D1C8AFF31151B.description:
The student will represent data and convert data between different number
systems.
